intro: Chamaesyce eichleri, commonly known as the Eichleri sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
